<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Deadly Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=1151) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad](/Sources.aspx?ID=14) pg. 78</row>

**Prerequisites**
[Improved Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=573)

</column>

---

Your poisons are devastatingly potent. When you apply a simple poison with [Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=563), the poison deals 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an [injury](/Traits.aspx?ID=97) poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.

<title level="2">Katapesh Poisoners</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad](/Sources.aspx?ID=14) pg. 78</row>

Famous not only for its pesh cash crop and the host of medicinal plants that grow naturally in the nearby desert, but also for the consistent demand for efficient toxins, Katapesh has developed its own specialized poisons and toxic techniques. The city's infamous Poison Maker's Guild is the source of many of these concoctions as well as secret techniques for using them, though unscrupulous Katapeshi bodyguards, thieves, and assassins all know at least one poison recipe or a unique means of inflicting such toxins.

**Related Feats**: [Pesh Skin](/Feats.aspx?ID=1152), [Shaped Contaminant](/Feats.aspx?ID=1153)
name: Deadly Poison Weapon
